DOC.HEAD: Brother of Singer Aretha Franklin Dies of Heart Attack
DOC.TEXT: The Rev. Cecil Franklin, singer Aretha Franklin's brother and personal manager, has died of a heart attack. He was 49. Franklin, who died at his home Tuesday, had been suffering from pneumonia for two months, said his wife, Earline. He was assistant pastor of New Bethel Baptist Church in Detroit. ``Cecil was Aretha's biggest fan,'' his wife said. ``Aretha and Cecil are very close _ they are more than sister and brother. Cecil really enjoyed hearing Aretha on stage.'' Born in 1940 in Memphis, Tenn., he became an aide to his father about 20 years ago at the church the Rev. C.L. Franklin Sr. founded in 1946. The elder Franklin, a civil rights activist, died in 1984 after spending five years in a coma from a beating by burglars at his home. In addition to his wife and sister, he is survived by a daughter, Cristal; a stepson, Luren Bowie; sisters Carella and Erma; a brother, Vaughn and a granddaughter.
